text: Teldenia apata is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Wilkinson in 1967. It is found in New Ireland, New Britain, Rook Island and New Hanover. The length of the forewings is 11.5-12.5 mm for males and 12.5-13.5 mm for females. The postmedial and subterminal fasciae on both the fore- and hindwings are light brown. The terminal fascia is dark brown and reduced to dots between the veins., 1967: A taxonomic revision of the genus Teldenia Moore (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae, Drepaninae). The Transactions of the Zoological Society of London Volume 119, Issue 11 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1967 Category:Drepaninae
title: Teldenia apata
